intro: Xolantha commutata, commonly known as the slender-stemmed xolantha, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, adapting to arid and semi-arid conditions. Its root system is well-developed, allowing it to thrive in poor soil conditions. Xolantha commutata is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
